string-array.name: tutorial_descriptions
string-array.item: Preskúmať a spojiť sa s prírodou
Choď von! Nájdi niečo v prírode a sprav ostrý obrázok v plnom rozlíšení.
Zdieľaj svoje pozorovanie s komunitou iNaturalist.
Vráť sa a pozri komentáre a identifikácie k pozorovaniu!
Research Grade pozorovania sú zdieľané s vedcami, ktorí pracujú na lepšom porozumení a ochrane prírody.

resources.string: ArgentiNat is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Argentina. Local institutions supporting ArgentiNat will have access to your email address and access to the true coordinates for observations that are publicly obscured or private. Please do not experimentally change your affiliation if you have more than 1000 observations. Would you like to change your affiliation?

Biodiversity4All is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Portugal. Local institutions supporting Biodiversity4All will have access to your email address and access to the true coordinates for observations that are publicly obscured or private. Please do not experimentally change your affiliation if you have more than 1000 observations. Would you like to change your affiliation?
Hlavná stránka iNaturalist siete. Kliknutím OK sa táto aplikácia stane súčasťou globálnej siete iNaturalist.

Naozaj chcete odhlásiť? Táto akcia odstráni všetky vaše pozorovania na tomto zariadení. Neovplyvní to žiadne pozorovania, ktoré ste nahrali do iNaturalist.
Sorry, but there was a problem loading the sound from this source
Ľutujeme, ale vyskytol sa problém s načítaním fotografie z tohto zdroja

The app you shared from creates photos that are not suitable for observations because they do not represent evidence of your experience with another organism, because they include inappropriate branding or commercial content, or because they violate our Terms of Service in other ways.

Google requires us to ask for permission to access your contacts in order to use your Google Account, even though we do not access your contacts for any reason. If you deny this permission, you will need to sign up or login with a username and password.

WebView prihlásenie vyžaduje povolenie na INTERNETE
Vaše heslo na Facebooku sa zmenilo. Prosím, znovu sa prihláste do tejto aplikácie pre znovupripojenie vášho Facebook účtu.
Táto aplikácia nemá oprávnenie na vykonanie tejto akcie. Ak chcete zmeniť povolenia, skúste sa znovu prihlásiť do aplikácie.
Prihláste sa do tejto aplikácie znova na opätovné prepojenie konta Facebook.
Prihláste sa do tejto aplikácie znova na opätovné prepojenie konta Facebook.
Váš účet na Facebooku je zablokovaný. Prosím, prihláste sa na www.facebook.com aby ste mohli pokračovať.
Ak si chcete pripojiť účet, vo svojom mobilnom zariadení otvorte aplikáciu Facebook a pozrite si upozornenia.
Máte to pod kontrolou – vyberte, ktoré informácie chcete zdieľať s aplikáciami.

"Aplikácia %1$s bude fungovať až po povolení služieb Google Play."

Začiarknite toto políčko, ak chcete použiť Create Commons Attribution-NonCommercial licenciu pre vaše fotografie. Môžete vybrať rôzne licencie alebo odobrať licenciu neskôr, ale toto je najlepšia licencia pre zdieľanie s výskumnými pracovníkmi.
Nepodarilo sa prevziať najnovšie pozorovania - problémy s pripojením. Skúste znova neskôr.
Couldn\'t play sound - probably a network issue
Nepodarilo sa načítať údaje sprievodcu - pravdepodobne chyba siete.
Couldn\'t retrieve sound from default recorder - try importing the sound instead
Navrhol a vyrobil iNaturalist.org s podporou California Academy of Sciences

Licensing your content gives anyone the legal right to use it without asking your permission if they abide by the terms of the license. In addition, iNat includes your Creative Commons-licensed content in regularly-updated archives produced for select partner organizations interested in our data. For example, we include No Copyright (CC0), Attribution (CC BY), and Attribution-NonCommercial (CC BY-NC) records in the archive we generate for the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF), an international, inter-governmental organization that compiles and distributes biodiversity information from around the world.

By deleting your account you will remove:

  • All of your observations, including the work of the all the people who have helped you out with identifications.
  • All of the identifications you\'ve added to the observations of other people, which will potentially affect the data quality of those observations.
  • All of the comments you\'ve added.

Furthermore, this action cannot be undone. If you change your mind later, you aren\'t getting any of that content back.

If this service generates too many notifications, consider editing your settings on the website to opt out of certain notifications or stop receiving email from us. If you\'re having trouble with a specific person, consider muting them instead of deleting your account.

If you\'re still sure you want to delete your account, enter \"%1$s\" in the form below and click the button to delete your account and all your data.

Zdá sa, že ste odstránili fotografiu vymazaním vyrovnávacej pamäte aplikácií pred jej nahranim. Budete musieť pridať fotografiu späť do svojho pozorovania z vašej galérie. Nabudúce sa uistite, že ste nahrali všetky fotografie pred vymazaním vyrovnávacej pamäte aplikácie.

It looks like you deleted a sound by clearing the app cache before uploading. You will need to add the sound back to your observation from your gallery. In the future, please make sure you have uploaded all your sounds before clearing the app cache.
To disable third party data sharing immediately, the app must restart.

Your observation was created (and submitted) on %1$s, but you\'re trying to set an observation date that is later than that: %2$s

Geoprivacy je nastavenie vašich pozorovaní, ktoré, ktoré riadi zobrazovanie priestorových súradníc (zemepisnú šírku a dĺžku). Možnosti sú:
verejné - každý môže vidieť súradnice, ak druh nie je ohrozený.
skryté - verejné súradnice zobrazené ako náhodný bod v rámci oblasti 0,2 x 0,2 stupňa, ktorý obsahuje skutočné súradnice, čo je asi 22 x 22 km štvorcových neistoty v oblasti na rovníku, klesá smerom k pólom. Skutočné súradnice sú viditeľné len pre vás a kurátorov projektov, do ktorých pridáte pozorovania.
súkromné - koordináty sú úplne skryté z verejných máp, skutočné súradnice sú viditeľné len pre vás a kurátorov projektov, do ktorý pridáte pozorovanie.

Zdôrazňujeme, že kurátori jednotlivé projektov môžu vždy vidieť súradnice bez ohľadu na nastavenia geosúkromia, takže ak pochybujete o tom kto má prístup k súradniciam mali by ste dôverovať kurátorom projektov, v ktorých sa zúčastníte.
Editor sprievodcov musí umožniť túto funkciu.
Má ID podporené dvoma alebo viacerými
I agree to the Terms of Service and Privacy Policy, and I have reviewed the Community Guidelines.
I consent to allow iNaturalist to store and process limited kinds of personal information about me in order to manage my account. Learn More
I don\'t know but I\'m sure this is %1$s.
iNaturalist is a joint initiative by the California Academy of Sciences and the National Geographic Society.

iNaturalist exists thanks to every single person who participates in our community. The people who build the software, design the interfaces, maintain our infrastructure, support the community, and foster collaborations are Yaron Budowski, Amanda Bullington, Tony Iwane, Patrick Leary, Scott Loarie, Abhas Misraraj, Carrie Seltzer, Alex Shepard, and Ken-ichi Ueda.

CalTech and Cornell Tech helped develop the computer vision system that suggests identifications from photographs. We thank Grant Van Horn, Serge Belongie, and Pietro Perona for advancing the computer vision research. More information can be found at visipedia.org. Special thanks to NVIDIA for additional assistance.
The international iNaturalist Network supports localized, fully integrated, iNaturalist-based websites in the following countries, thanks to the support of associated partner organizations.

iNaturalist is also deeply grateful to the open source developers who have provided so much of the software we rely on every day. See https://github.com/inaturalist/iNaturalistAndroid for open source contributions.
We are grateful for the translation assistance provided by volunteers in the crowdin.com community, especially Eduardo Martínez, Lin Cheng-Tao, KestrelLam, cgalindo, vilseskog, NCAA, ldacosta, radana, Mykola Pukhalskyi, danieleseglie, and katunchik.
IUCN category II places provided by IUCN and UNEP-WCMC (2015), The World Database on Protected Areas (WDPA) [On-line], [11/2014], Cambridge, UK: UNEP-WCMC. Available at: www.protectedplanet.net

The iNaturalist Network is a framework for localizing the iNaturalist community. Network sites are supported by local institutions that have signed an agreement with iNaturalist to encourage local use and benefit local biodiversity.
Internetové pripojenie sa zdá byť offline.

Chyba pri importe fotky (fotiek): môžete importovať iba súbory JPG/JPEG/PNG

There was a problem updating the photos in this observation that has recently been fixed. Please sign out and sign in again to resolve this issue.

This license releases your work into the public domain, so others can copy, modify, distribute and perform your work, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission or giving you credit. This is the most accommodating of licenses offered. Recommended for maximum dissemination and use of licensed materials.
This license lets others distribute, remix, tweak, and build upon your work, even commercially, as long as they credit you for the original creation.

This license lets others remix, tweak, and build upon your work non-commercially, and although their new works must also acknowledge you and be non-commercial, they don\'t have to license their derivative works on the same terms.

This license is the most restrictive of the six main licenses, only allowing others to download your works and share them with others as long as they credit you, but they can\'t change them in any way or use them commercially.
This license lets others remix, tweak, and build upon your work non-commercially, as long as they credit you and license their new creations under the identical terms.
This license allows for redistribution, commercial and non-commercial, as long as it is passed along unchanged and in whole, with credit to you.

This license lets others remix, adapt, and build upon your work even for commercial purposes, as long as they credit you and license their new creations under the identical terms. This license is often compared to “copyleft” free and open source software licenses. All new works based on yours will carry the same license, so any derivatives will also allow commercial use. This is the license used by Wikipedia, and is recommended for materials that would benefit from incorporating content from Wikipedia and similarly licensed projects.
You retain full copyright over your content aside from those rights granted to iNaturalist in our Terms of Service.

Argentina: Fundación Vida Silvestre Argentina supporting ArgentiNat (www.argentinat.org)
Portugal: Associação Biodiversidade Para Todos operating Biodiversity4All (Biodiversity4All.org)
Australia: Atlas of Living Australia supporting iNaturalist Australia (inaturalist.ala.org.au)
Canada: Canadian Wildlife Federation, the Royal Ontario Museum, NatureServe Canada, and Parks Canada operating iNaturalist Canada (inaturalist.ca)
Chile: Ministerio del Medio Ambiente supporting iNaturalist Chile (inaturalist.mma.gob.cl)
Costa Rica: Comisión Nacional para la Gestión de la Biodiversidad (CONAGEBIO) supporting Naturalista Costa Rica (costarica.inaturalist.org)
Ecuador: Instituto Nacional de Biodiversidad (INABIO) supporting iNaturalist Ecuador (ecuador.inaturalist.org)
Finland: Finnish Museum of Natural History (LUOMUS) supporting iNaturalist Finland (inaturalist.laji.fi)
Guatemala: Consejo Nacional de Áreas Protegidas (CONAP) supporting iNaturalist Guatemala (guatemala.inaturalist.org)
Israel: University of Haifa supporting iNaturalist Israel (israel.inaturalist.org)
Luxembourg: Luxembourg National Museum of Natural History (MnhnL) supporting iNaturalist Luxembourg (inaturalist.lu)
Panama: Ministerio de Ambiente operating iNaturalistPa (panama.inaturalist.org)
Sweden: SLU Swedish Species Information Centre supporting iNaturalist Sweden (www.inaturalist.se)
United Kingdom: National Biodiversity Network Trust supporting iNaturalist United Kingdom (uk.inaturalist.org)
Mexico: Comisión nacional para el conocimiento y uso de la biodiversidad (CONABIO) operating NaturaLista (NaturaLista.mx)
New Zealand: New Zealand Biodiversity Recording Network operating iNaturalist NZ — Mātaki Taiao (inaturalist.nz)

Vráť sa skoro a pozri identifikácie a komentáre k pozorovaniu (niam).
Opt in to the Community Taxon

Opting out of the Community Taxon forces this observation to be associated with the taxon from your current identification, not a taxon derived from all the identifications that have been added to this observation. If enough identifiers disagree with you, your observation will become Casual. You should only opt out if you are sure your identification is correct and other identifications are incorrect.
Opt out of the Community Taxon
Heslo, ktoré aplikácia používa, už nefunguje - zmenili ste heslo na webových stránkach? Zadajte prosím nové
Password must be at least six characters long

We store personal information like usernames and email addresses in order to manage accounts on this site, and to comply with privacy laws, we need you to check this box to indicate that you consent to this use of personal information. To learn more about what information we collect and how we use it, please see our Privacy Policy and our Terms of Service.

Toto sú odkazy konkrétneho taxónu. Sú v poradí od všeobecnejšieho k špecifickejšiemu. Použi tieto odkazy pre pohyb nahor a nadol po strome života. Napríklad, ak nepoznáš o aký druh ide ale vieš do akej skupiny patrí, klikni na taxón zo zoznamu a získaj viac informácii.

Vyskytol sa problém pri aktualizácii profilu!
Vyskytol sa problém pri aktualizácii profilu: %1$s

We use a variety of third-party services to monitor stability and diagnose bugs and problems in our software. These third parties include:
  • Google (Google Analytics, Firebase Crashlytics)
  • New Relic

Information we share with these third parties include:
  • IP addresses (which can be used to derive location at city-level resolution, and to track you across different websites and services; note that we have enabled IP anonymization in Google Analytics and Firebase Crashlytics does not record IP address to our knowledge)
  • Browser details, like make, model, and version
  • Crash details, like exactly what line of code caused a crash
  • Device details, like make and model of a mobile phone

These third-party services provide enormous value to us in maintaining the stability and usability of iNaturalist with our relatively small staff. On mobile devices, there is almost no other way we can gain insight into problems that are occurring since the software is running on devices we do not control. Sometimes we aren’t even aware such problems are occurring until we see them in the data these services provide. By sharing this information, you are helping us serve you and the entire iNaturalist community.

Note that this option only applies to analytics and crash data that we are explicitly sending to these companies. All iNaturalist servers are provided and hosted by Microsoft, all iNaturalist images are hosted by Amazon, and almost all iNaturalist maps are served by Google, which means every time you look at an observation on iNaturalist, you are connecting to services provided by these companies and exposing your IP address to them, at the very least (in the iPhone app we use Apple’s maps). iNaturalist probably would not exist without the services these companies provide, and while we can limit the amount and kinds of data you share with them while using iNat, we cannot stop the flow of data entirely.
To access your location you must grant location access permission to this app.

iNaturalist will provide suggestions based on how visually similar the images are to those of species observed near this location at this time of year.

If you\'re adding photos of different kinds of organisms to this observation, or the same kind at different places or times, you should remove those photos and add them as separate observations. An observation can only have %1$d photos.
